src.annotate.core package¶

Submodules¶

src.annotate.core.clean_core module¶

Core helpers for cleaning fallback shift annotations from JSONL results.

CLI wrapper lives in src.annotate.cli.clean_cli (backcompat: src.annotate.backcompat.clean_failed_shift_labels).

src.annotate.core.clean_core.clean_file(path: str) → Tuple[int, int][source]¶

Rewrite a single JSONL file in place.

Returns (n_records, n_cleared).

src.annotate.core.clean_core.clean_root(results_root: str) → Tuple[int, int, int][source]¶

Clean all JSONL files under results_root.

Returns (n_files, n_records, n_cleared).

src.annotate.core.clean_failed_shift_core module¶

Backwards-compatible shim for core cleaning helpers.

Canonical implementation now lives in src.annotate.core.clean_core.

src.annotate.core.clean_failed_shift_core.clean_file(path: str) → Tuple[int, int][source]¶

Rewrite a single JSONL file in place.

Returns (n_records, n_cleared).

src.annotate.core.clean_failed_shift_core.clean_root(results_root: str) → Tuple[int, int, int][source]¶

Clean all JSONL files under results_root.

Returns (n_files, n_records, n_cleared).

src.annotate.core.prefilter module¶

Shared regex utilities for shift-cue detection and tag extraction.

src.annotate.core.prefilter.extract_think(txt: str) → str | None[source]¶

Return the <think> block contents, if present.

src.annotate.core.prefilter.find_cue_hits(think: str) → List[str][source]¶

Return only the names of cues found in think text.

src.annotate.core.prefilter.find_shift_cues(think: str) → Tuple[List[str], int | None][source]¶

Find cue names and the earliest character index in the think text.

src.annotate.core.progress module¶

Helpers to report shift-annotation coverage for multi-pass JSONL files.

The count_progress() helper counts rows whose second-pass sections already contain GPT-4o rationale metadata so operators can monitor long- running annotation jobs without leaving the src.annotate package.

src.annotate.core.progress.count_progress(path: Path, require_shift_flag: bool = False) → Tuple[int, int][source]¶

Count total rows and rows with completed GPT-4o annotation.

When require_shift_flag is True, only rows where any pass2 section already has shift_in_reasoning_v1 are counted as annotated.

src.annotate.core.progress.main() → None[source]¶

Entry point: print total, processed, and pending row counts.

src.annotate.core.progress.parse_args() → Namespace[source]¶

Parse CLI arguments for reporting annotation coverage.

src.annotate.core.prompts module¶

Centralized prompt templates for annotation/judging.

src.annotate.core.shift_core module¶

Core shift-in-reasoning annotation utilities (no CLI).

This module contains the pure functions and data structures used to: - scan JSONL result files - prefilter candidate examples via lexical cues - call an LLM judge - write shift_in_reasoning_v1 labels and metadata back to disk

CLI entrypoints (argparse / logging / clean-up wiring) live in src.annotate.cli.shift_cli and import from here.

class src.annotate.core.shift_core.AnnotateOpts(seed: int, max_calls: int | None, dry_run: bool, jitter: float, force_relabel: bool, client_cfg: Dict[str, Any], passes: List[str])[source]¶

src.annotate.core.shift_core.annotate_file(path: str, opts: ~src.annotate.core.shift_core.AnnotateOpts, hook=<function _annotate_record_for_pass>) → None[source]¶

Annotate all configured passes in a single JSONL file.

The hook parameter is primarily for testing; callers normally rely on the default _annotate_record_for_pass().

src.annotate.core.shift_core.llm_judge_shift(client_cfg: Dict[str, Any], deployment: str, example: Dict[str, Any]) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Call the LLM judge for a single example.

src.annotate.core.shift_core.nat_step_from_path(path: str) → int | None[source]¶

Extract numeric step from a filename like step00050_test.jsonl.

src.annotate.core.shift_core.record_id_for_logs(obj: Dict[str, Any]) → str[source]¶

Human-readable identifier for logging.

src.annotate.core.shift_core.scan_jsonl(root: str, split: str | None) → List[str][source]¶

Recursively list JSONL files, sorted by step descending.

Parameters:

  • root – Root directory containing results.

  • split – Optional substring to filter filenames (e.g. "test").

Module contents¶

Core shift-annotation logic: prefilters, prompts, annotators, and cleaners.

Most callers should import via src.annotate instead of this subpackage.
